answers.answer:
Yes, free legal help is available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania and other countries, including pro bono assistance, campaigns offering free legal aid, and complimentary legal counseling services.

You can find detailed information by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and reading under the "Legal Help" section.

answers.answer:
The 'Lawyers for refugees' campaign is an initiative by the National Association of the Romanian Bars that provides free legal and humanitarian assistance to Ukrainian refugees. It aims to match refugees seeking legal help with lawyers willing to offer support.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and look for the section titled 'Lawyers for refugees' or search for 'UA.SUPPORT'.

Ukrainian refugees can find legal help through pro bono services offered by the National Association of the Romanian Bars via UA.SUPPORT, by contacting ACTEDO for assistance with refugee status or civil issues, or by utilizing legal counseling and lawyer lists provided by UNHCR and CNRR.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read under the "Legal Help" section.

ACTEDO provides legal assistance to refugees for problems such as obtaining refugee status or for resolving various civil or administrative legal issues they may encounter during their stay in Romania.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help` and look for the section titled "Ask for help ACTEDO".

Yes, CNRR offers complimentary legal counseling to refugees and asylum seekers in collaboration with UNHCR. You can contact them directly through their dedicated hotline, WhatsApp, Telegram, or Viber for assistance.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read under the section titled "Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers".

answers.answer:
CNRR can be contacted for legal assistance via their dedicated hotline at +40730073170. This service is also accessible through WhatsApp, Telegram, and Viber, available Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM - 10:00 PM.

To find this detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and look for the section titled "Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers".
